name: Mitt Romney
description: Voted to convict Donald Trump in both impeachment trials and criticized Trump's role in the January 6 Capitol riot. Known for moderate positions including support for state-level healthcare mandates.

name: Mitch McConnell
description: Former Senate Majority Leader criticized by the party's populist wing. Worked with Democrats on infrastructure and government funding, and condemned Trump's actions on January 6.

name: Susan Collins
description: Considered one of the most moderate Senate Republicans. Voted against repeal of the Affordable Care Act, supported limited gun control measures, and defended abortion rights.

name: Lisa Murkowski
description: Known for her independent streak, supporting abortion rights and environmental policies. Voted to convict Trump in his second impeachment trial.

name: Liz Cheney
description: Voted to impeach Trump following January 6 Capitol riot and served on the House committee investigating the event. Outspoken critic of Trump despite otherwise conservative record.

name: Adam Kinzinger
description: One of ten House Republicans who voted to impeach Trump after January 6. Participated in the January 6 committee and criticized Trump's influence.

name: John Kasich
description: Challenged Trump in the 2016 primaries. Refused to endorse Trump in 2016, supported Joe Biden in 2020, and advocated for bipartisan governance.

name: Jeff Flake
description: Criticized Trump's rhetoric and behavior during his Senate tenure. Expressed concerns about erosion of democratic norms and chose not to seek re-election in 2018.

name: Anthony Gonzalez
description: Voted to impeach Trump after January 6 and criticized his actions. Faced strong opposition from within the party, leading him to forego re-election in 2022.

name: Paul Ryan
description: Led the House from 2015 to 2019. Critics claim he wasn't aggressive enough on issues like immigration and occasionally criticized Trump after retiring in 2018.
